fields.name: The Training Ground
fields.description: Finished the Beginner's Cave but not sure you're ready for that big, bad world? Visit the Training Ground to hone your skills and pick up some loot in the process!
fields.full_description:
You're an inexperienced adventurer, but you know how to listen and pick up some good info once in a while. When you heard that there was a place outside of town that gave beginning adventurers a chance to hone their skills and pick up some loot in the process, naturally you jumped at the opportunity to make the most of this deal.

So, you hitchhiked your way out there, and readied your weapons and yourself as you approached the Main entrance...

fields.name: You are at the entrance. (E/D)
fields.description: You are at the entrance to the Training Ground. A lonely road heads east to the Main Hall, and an archway in the side of the mountain reveals stairs leading down into darkness...

fields.name: You are at the bottom of a flight of stairs. (N/U)
fields.description: You are at the bottom of a flight of stairs in a small alcove of a room. The room opens out to the north. Light is provided by a flaming torch bolted fast to the wall.

fields.name: You are at a four-way intersection. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: Hallways lead north, east, and west, and the landing of the stairs is south.

fields.name: You are in a hallway. (N/S)
fields.description: You are in a featureless grey stone hall leading north and south.

fields.name: You are in a hallway with doors. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: The north/south hallway continues here. There are also doorways to the east and west.

fields.name: You are in a small, dark room. (E)
fields.description: You are in a small, very dark room which is featureless except for debris strewn all over the floor. The only exit is a doorway to the east.

fields.name: You are in a small room. (W)
fields.description: The only exit is a doorway to the west. There is a wooden chest against the east wall.

fields.name: You are at a bend. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: The hallway bends from the south to the west here. There is also a doorway to the east and a large wooden door to the north.

fields.name: You are in a small cell. (S)
fields.description: You are in a room that appears to be a small cell. The only exit is south and there are no other features in here.

fields.name: You are in a mural room. (W)
fields.description: You are in a room to which the solitary exit lies westward. The entire east wall is taken up by a mural depicting a large Aztec-like pyramid. You recognize the pyramid as the legendary Scholar's Tomb.

fields.name: You are in a dark hall. (E/W)
fields.description: You are in a spooky east and west hall with shadows all around.

fields.name: You are in a dark hall. (E/W)
fields.description: You are in a spooky east and west hall with shadows all around.

fields.name: You are at a bend. (S/E)
fields.description: The dark corridor bends to the south and east.

fields.name: You are in a dark hallway. (N/S/E)
fields.description: You are in a dark north/south hallway in which shadows seem to creep up in every location. Somebody has left a secret door lying open in the east wall.

fields.name: You are in a dark hallway. (N/S)
fields.description: You are in a dark north/south hallway in which it seems unusually creepy and full of shadows.

fields.name: You are in a secret hallway. (S/W)
fields.description: You are in a short hall which leads to the south and opens up into a room. The non-secret side of a secret door can be seen in the west wall.

fields.name: You are in a filthy room. (N)
fields.description: You are in a medium-sized room that is strewn with debris, refuse, and scraps of food. You also see six mats of straw that appear to be sleeping places. The only exit is north. There is light from a torch bolted to the wall.

fields.name: You are at a bend. (N/E/W)
fields.description: The corridor bends to the north and east here. There is also a door to the west. Light is provided by a torch bolted to the wall.

fields.name: You are in the mural room. (E)
fields.description: You are in a room which has a singular exit to the east. The west wall is covered by a mural depicting the ancient council of twelve, a group of warriors and mages who used to rule. Each member wears a robe or armor of one distinct color.

fields.name: You are in a corridor. (E/W)
fields.description: You are in a corridor that leads east and west. You cannot make out much in either direction with the light your torch provides.

fields.name: You are in a corridor. (N/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a corridor that leads east and west. There is also a door to the north.

fields.name: You are in the Norse mural room. (S)
fields.description: You are in a room with a singular exit to the south. A mural on the north wall depicts the entire Norse pantheon of the gods with special detail on the god Thor and his weapon, a hammer. There is an aura of magic here that is quite strong.

fields.name: You are at a bend. (N/E/W)
fields.description: The corridor bends to the north and west here. There is also a doorway leading to the east.

fields.name: You are in the library. (W)
fields.description: You are in the library (most dungeons have one, don't they?). The north, east and south walls are taken up by shelves of books. Most of the books strike you as being dull and boring stuff, but there are a few that catch your eye...

fields.name: You are in the secret scroll room behind the library. (W)
fields.description: The walls are covered with cubbyholes for storing scroll cases, but there are only a couple of scroll cases remaining. The only exit is west.

fields.name: You are at a bend. (S/E)
fields.description: The corridor bends to the south and east here. Looking to both the south and the east you see two more bends in the hall.

fields.name: You are at a bend. (N/W)
fields.description: The corridor bends to the north and west here. To the west, you see another bend in the hall, and to the north, the hall opens up into a chamber. There is flickering torch-light dancing all around you.

fields.name: You are in the portcullis chamber. (N/S/E)
fields.description: You are in a medium-sized chamber where there are three exits. The corridor is south and a portcullis blocks each of the other two tunnels, one to the west and one to the north. The gates can be easily opened. Torchlight is here.

fields.name: You are in a small tunnel. (N/S)
fields.description: You are in a small, dark north/south tunnel. The tunnel bends to the north and opens into a chamber to the south.

fields.name: You are at a bend in the tunnel. (S/E)
fields.description: You are at a south and east bend in the tunnel. The tunnel is too dark to see what lies in either direction.

fields.name: You are at a dead end in the tunnel. (W)
fields.description: The tunnel comes to a dead end here with the only exit being back to the west.

fields.name: You are in a cave-like chamber. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a chamber that looks rough-hewn like a cave of some sort. Tunnel openings lead north, east, and south, while you see light in a chamber to the west.

fields.name: You are at a bend in the tunnel. (N/E)
fields.description: You are in a rough-hewn cave tunnel that leads north and east.

fields.name: You are in a rough-hewn cave chamber. (N/W)
fields.description: Exits lead through tunnels to the north and west.

fields.name: You are at a bend in the tunnel. (S/W)
fields.description: You are in a rough-hewn cave tunnel that leads south and west.

fields.name: You are at a dead end in the tunnel. (S)
fields.description: The tunnel comes to a dead end here with the only exit being back to the south.

fields.name: torch
fields.description: You see an unlit torch fitted loosely in a holder on the opposite wall.

fields.name: pamphlet
fields.description: You see a small, very colorful pamphlet.

fields.name: blackjack
fields.description: You see the thug's blackjack.

fields.name: dagger
fields.description: You see the thug's dagger.

fields.name: chest
fields.description: The chest is made of wood and wrapped with iron bands. The lock appears to have been picked.

fields.name: ancient urn
fields.description: You find an urn that appears to be from Ancient Greece. This could be worth a lot to the right people.

fields.name: gold coins
fields.description: You find around two hundred gold coins in the bottom of the chest!

fields.name: rapier
fields.description: You see a long, thin steel rapier. An inscription on the handle says, "Jacques" in scripted letters.

fields.name: key
fields.description: You see a metal key that the rogue had concealed in his pocket.

fields.name: wooden door
fields.description: The large wooden door is made of very hard wood and looks very sturdy.

fields.name: dead adventurer
fields.description: You see a dead body here. Upon further inspection, you see that is was a young adventurer. There are four or five arrows sticking in his back, and there is a pool of fresh blood under the body.

fields.name: spear
fields.description: You see a good-quality spear clutched in the corpse's hand.

fields.name: backpack
fields.description: You see a leather adventurer's backpack here. The adventurer was apparently not wearing the backpack at the time of his demise for there are no arrows stuck in it.

fields.name: torch#
fields.description: You see a torch similar to the one you found in the entryway.

fields.name: purple potion
fields.description: You see a flask containing a purple substance. The flask is labeled "Hale 'N' Hearty." There appears to be enough for several swigs.

fields.name: hatchet
fields.description: You see a kobold's hatchet.

fields.name: short bow
fields.description: You see a kobold's short bow.

fields.name: short bow#
fields.description: You see a kobold's short bow.

fields.name: club
fields.description: You see a kobold's club.

fields.name: short sword
fields.description: You see a kobold's short sword.

fields.name: short bow##
fields.description: You see a kobold's short bow.

fields.name: long sword
fields.description: You see an elven long sword here.

fields.name: long bow
fields.description: You see an elven long bow here.

fields.name: Thor's hammer
fields.description: You see a massive war hammer here that is partially embedded in the mural next to the painting of Thor. You could take it from the wall. The weapon is steel with inlaid jewels and looks devastating in its power.

fields.name: red book
fields.description: You see a book bound in bright red fake leather on a shelf on the south wall. The title reads, "Using Lizards in your Alchemical Concoctions."

fields.name: green book
fields.description: You see a green book bound in the skin of an alligator or something. The title reads "The Metaphysical Ramblings of Leonard the New-Age Prophet." This book is shelved in the north bookshelf.

fields.name: purple book
fields.description: You see a purple book which is shelved on the east wall. The title reads "The Life and Times of Thaddeus the Scholar."

fields.name: wood scroll case
fields.description: In one of the cubbyholes you see a beat up old wooden scroll case.

fields.name: plain scroll
fields.description: You see a plain white scroll which was rolled up inside the scroll case. To your surprise you can read the scroll even with your limited magical experience.

fields.name: obsidian scroll case
fields.description: You see a scroll case made of the black obsidian. The case has not a scratch on it and radiates a strong aura of magic.

fields.name: Jade Blade
fields.description: You see the Emerald Warrior's broadsword, the "Jade Blade".

fields.name: sack of coins
fields.description: You see a small sack of silver coins on the floor. It looks as if some careless adventurer must have dropped this.

fields.name: Zapf's staff
fields.description: You see a long wooden staff that has an amethyst set in one end. There is an inscription along the length of it that reads, "Zapf the Conjurer."

fields.name: sword
fields.description: You see an average-quality sword.

fields.name: sword#
fields.description: You see an average-quality sword.

fields.name: mace
fields.description: You see an average-quality mace.

fields.name: mace#
fields.description: You see an average-quality mace.

fields.name: north portcullis
fields.description: The portcullis is a huge iron gate that can be easily raised or lowered from a winch on the wall.

fields.name: east portcullis
fields.description: The portcullis is a huge iron gate that can be easily raised or lowered from a winch on the wall.

fields.name: red potion
fields.description: You see a small vial filled with a red liquid. There's not much there but it looks pretty potent.

fields.name: blue potion
fields.description: You see a small vial filled with a blue liquid. There's not much there but it looks pretty potent.

fields.name: brass coins
fields.description: You see a pile of brass coins here. The pile is big - more than two hundred coins - but brass isn't worth much compared to gold.

fields.name: brooch
fields.description: You see a brooch made of wrought silver and gold. It looks fairly valuable.

fields.name: gold coins#
fields.description: You see a pile of about two hundred gold coins!

fields.name: topaz
fields.description: You see a large golden yellow topaz. It is a quite precious gemstone.

fields.name: graffiti
fields.description: You can also see by the light of your torch what appears to be graffiti scrawled on the walls.

fields.name: graffiti
fields.description: You can make out more graffiti writing on the walls here, also.

fields.name: graffiti
fields.description: More dungeon graffiti adorns the walls here.

fields.name: graffiti
fields.description: There is some graffiti writing on the wall here.

fields.name: graffiti
fields.description: There are marks of graffiti writing on the wall here.

fields.text:
****** WELCOME TO THE BARROW DOWNS TRAINING GROUND! *****

Well, you've been to the Beginner's Cave, but do you really feel ready to tackle that big world out there on your own? Maybe you don't, and that's why we've set up this practice facility for adventurers of little or no experience. To challenge you, the complex is stocked daily with beasts, non-humans, criminals, and other perils, not to mention $TREASURE$. NOTE: The adventurer enters at their own risk! The management assumes no legal responsibility for the safety of the adventurer. Good luck!
The woman speaks in a soft voice: "You seem honorable enough. I will go with you and maybe we will both make it out with our lives."
You hear a voice from behind the door to the north: "Help me, help me! I am held captif in zis room! Somebodee let me out!"
The female elf speaks: "I am Sylvani and my partner is Don Jonson. We seek peace and would rather be friends instead of enemies with you. Cooperation would be beneficial for all of us."
As you cast the spell, a warm glow comes from the mural where Thor's hammer used to be. You realize that the weapon is materializing and becoming real!

The book reads, "For most purposes the Excamian Fire-Newt is the ideal lifeform for alchemical concoctions. In the event of the unavailability of this type, the Purple Chameleon of Og is a suitable substitution..." It goes on and on...
The book reads, "I am life...You are life...The world is a flower...The universe is pink..." You don't care to read much more of this garbage...

The book reads, "Thaddeus the Scholar was possibly the most learned man who ever lived. The period of his greatest works was about 253 E.A.R." (about 500 years ago) "Legends say that his body lies in a great tomb, but no one has found it."

"Special for novice mages!! By reciting these simple magic words <PRESTO BLAMMO KAPOWIE> you can cast the BLAST spell four times a day or more!" The scroll vanishes as you read the words, but you feel that you have a new magic power!
As you remove the purple book from the bookshelf, you hear a grating noise as a part of the wall turns and opens up to reveal a secret room to the east!
As you remove the obsidian scroll case, there is a flicker of light as a large human figure materializes in the corner of the room!
The Emerald Warrior takes the case containing the Scroll of Power. "Now the power is finally mine!" he shouts. He then laughs maniacally and disappears as quickly as he materialized.
You hear sounds of a scuffle around the bend to the east!

Zapf the Conjurer begins to murmur magic incantations and wave his staff around wildly. He then utters a shout and leaps into the air! As he lands with a stomp, there is a flash of light and a puff of smoke!
A huge man in uniform comes out to inspect you. "I'm the manager." he says.
"Well, I'm afraid you're overqualified. Normally I'd make you return to town... But what the heck, I'm feeling generous today! You may proceed."
"You don't look old enough to be doing this, but I'm gonna let you in anyway."
Bozworth frowns at you and then vanishes before you can hit him!
Bozworth dodges your blast and then vanishes in a puff of smoke!
Jacques says, "How can I ever zank you?"
It says, "If you are reading this...                                                then you can't be watching...                                                  ...your back!"
It says, "Conan's sword is sharper than he is."
It says, "What's uglier than an orc? ...... Nothing!!!"
It says, "Hewg the Sorcerer wuz here."
It says, "Assassins do it from behind."
"Thanks, buddy, but a potion costs 100 gold pieces."
"Sorry, bub, all out. But thanks for asking."
"Hey, thanks for the tip, pal!"
The gnome takes your money and gives you a potion.
You strike fear into thy foes when you invoke the power of the Hammer of Thor!
ZAP!! You are struck by lightning!

fields.name: Red Sun
fields.description: You hear a voice in the shadows behind you! Spinning around, you see a small Asian woman dressed in black and wearing a headband depicting the rising sun. She eyes you warily.

fields.name: Thug1
fields.description: Suddenly you see someone leap out of the shadows at you! It is a thug, and he attempts to brain you with his blackjack!

fields.name: Thug2
fields.description: Another thug emerges from the darkness with a mean-looking dagger.

fields.name: Rogue
fields.description: A man is crouching in front of the chest when you enter. Upon hearing you, the rogue picks up a long, thin sword and advances toward you with a wicked look on his face!

fields.name: Jacques
fields.description: You see a man whose clothes are all torn to tatters. "Zank for rescuing me," he says, "My name is Jacques. Did you find ma rapier?"

fields.name: Kobold1
fields.description: You see a dark brown humanoid with small horns leap out of the shadows! It is a kobold and it swings its hatchet at you!

fields.name: Kobold2
fields.description: Another kobold leaps out of the shadows! This one is armed with a short bow.

fields.name: Kobold3
fields.description: Another kobold leaps out and readies his short bow!

fields.name: Kobold4
fields.description: Yet another kobold emerges from the dark shadows. This one readies his club and charges at you!

fields.name: Kobold5
fields.description: You see two kobolds playing some sort of game on the floor as you enter. They see you and jump to their feet! One grabs a short sword and the other a short bow.

fields.name: Kobold6
fields.description: You see the other kobold.

fields.name: Sylvani
fields.description: You see a female elf studying the mural on the wall. When she hears you she says a word of warning to her companion and draws her elven long sword. She then waits tensely.

fields.name: Don Jonson
fields.description: The other elf turns, readies his longbow and stares at you intently.

fields.name: Emerald Warrior
fields.description: You see a man wearing glittering emerald plate mail and holding a huge broadsword with one hand. "Give me the Scroll of Power," he says, "or I shall destroy you immediately."

fields.name: Zapf the Conjurer
fields.description: You see a man in robes being accosted by four other people. He is being held up against the wall by one of the bullies and punched by a couple of the others.

fields.name: Francis
fields.description: Francis, the big bully, throws the robed figure to the ground and draws his sword saying, "Well, well. Looks like we got ourselves another sucker! Come on, boys!" he says as he advances toward you menacingly.

fields.name: Winifred
fields.description: Winifred looks at Francis. He then draws his sword and starts toward you.

fields.name: William
fields.description: William readies his mace and glares at you with a mean look on his face.

fields.name: Ogden
fields.description: Ogden reluctantly readies his mace and cowers behind Francis.

fields.name: Bozworth the Gnome
fields.description: You see a gnome in flashy multi-colored clothes. When he sees you he smiles and says, "Hello, Bozworth the Gnome at your service. You want one of these babies?" He holds up a red potion and says, "Only a hundred gold pieces. C'mon, it's worth it!"

fields.name: Ochre Jelly
fields.description: You see what looks like a giant amoeba! It is the dreaded ochre jelly and it is oozing in your direction!

fields.name: Giant Lizard
fields.description: You see a giant subterranean lizard with huge jaws and a tough-looking hide. It attempts to have you for lunch!

fields.name: Hydra
fields.description: You see a five-headed hydra! This fearsome creature looks like a dragon but it has five heads and each one is trying to bite you!

fields.question: What do I do in the Norse mural room?
What do I do with the Hammer of Thor?
What do I do about the Emerald Warrior?
Help! I had an unrequested sex change!
What do I do with Bozworth?
All secrets of the Training Ground revealed. (Spoiler alert!)
Zapf the Conjurer keeps summoning monsters!

fields.answer: Cast the POWER spell to gain a hidden treasure.
SAY THOR (or USE HAMMER) to reduce the courage of your enemies by 3/4.
If you don't want to fight him, GIVE OBSIDIAN SCROLL CASE to him.
Keep casting the POWER spell until your sex reverts to normal (20% chance each time).
OPEN BACKPACK then REMOVE TORCH# FROM BACKPACK and use that as a light source after the first torch runs out.
He has two healing potions for sale, which you can buy with BUY POTION. After that you can just ignore him. Note: If you act hostile towards him, he will disappear before he can be harmed.
Note: The following will give away everything about this adventure. Read on only if you are sure that you are done playing or don't wish to explore this adventure anymore...
First off, read all of the other hints, as the information that is in them won't be repeated here...
...GIVE RAPIER TO JACQUES and he will thank you; READ PLAIN SCROLL to get a temporary 250% increase in your BLAST ability with a permanent 10% increase included;

...Aside from specials mentioned in other hints, the POWER spell has a 40% chance of giving your character a +2 Charisma increase and a 5% chance of having them struck by lightning; there are five rooms where you can READ GRAFFITI for amusing messages;
...GET PURPLE BOOK in the library to reveal a secret passage;
...EXAMINE CHEST in the room where you find the rogue who stole Jacques' rapier to make it appear and open it to reveal valuable treasures.
Every turn, Zapf has a 15% chance of casting a summoning spell, which can bring monsters into the room and even resurrect dead monsters. He can only do this if he has his staff.
To stop him from casting his spell, you can REQUEST STAFF FROM ZAPF and hang onto it. You can then give him a different weapon so he can still help with combat.
